item.title: Report E-2024070103
item.description:
Report E-2024070103

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-09T15:13:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-03
  • City: ST PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) gallons of material released from nine (9) 5-gallon poly pail. The released material impacted the tailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and recovered the spent absorbents and containerized it into one (1) 10-gallon metal drum. The damaged plastic pails were placed into two (2) 60-gallon metal drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024070335
item.description:
Report X-2024070335

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-09T15:13:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-30
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO DOOR 20 OF THE UNLOAD FOR A LEAKING FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT. RESPONDER SHOWED UP WITH PPE ON AND SPILL CART. UTILIZING DECISION TREE AND FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET, RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL. LEAKING PACKAGE WAS PLACED INTO SPILL TUB AND TRANSPORTED BACK TO DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024070045
item.description:
Report E-2024070045

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: GRANDVIEW
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed that the released material impacted a concrete terminal floor and estimated that three (3) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 85-gallon poly drum. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned up the released material and overpacked the damaged drum and generated waste. The generated waste was staged onsite at their terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
